ADORecipient.description: ADOs use a default Receive message for handling funds, this struct states that the recipient is an ADO and may attach the data field to the Receive message

address.description: Addr can also be a human-readable identifier used in a mission contract.

identifier.description: Can be either an address or identifier of an ADO in a mission.

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>

Decimal.description:
A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0

The greatest possible value that can be represented is 340282366920938463463.374607431768211455 (which is (2^128 - 1) / 10^18)

oneOf.description: An address that is not another ADO. It is assumed that it is a valid address.

Splitter.description: A config struct for a `Splitter` contract.

locked.description: Whether or not the contract is currently locked. This restricts updating any config related fields.

recipients.description: The vector of recipients for the contract. Anytime a `Send` execute message is sent the amount sent will be divided amongst these recipients depending on their assigned percentage.
